channel.title: Julia on loualiche misc.
channel.description: Recent content in Julia on loualiche misc.

item.title: Using DuckDB with Julia
item.description: Some data tasks can be conveniently outsourced to DuckDB instead of using DataFrames. I go over the bindings and how I use it from within Julia.

item.title: TAQ Consolidated
item.description: For a recent revision, I have had to dig into TAQ data; I did not want to use SAS and I thought a combination of command line unix tools and julia would be easy. I learned a few things!

item.title: ST-Julia-IDE
item.description: I have been asked how to set up a simple Julia IDE (not VSCode) for people who are already using Sublime Test. There are a few things that need to line up for it to work smoothly. I wrote these steps down.

item.title: DataFrames and datatable
item.description: A guide for moving between Julia’s DataFrames.jl and R data.table. This follows the template of stata2r and gives side by side matches of common operation for data wrangling.

item.title: KP-Fstats-Julia
item.description: There are (were?) some issues with F-statistics estimation in stata for IV regressions. We simulate data to reproduce the problem and present a fix in the julia FixedEffectModels.jl library.
